column3: Viral Kinetics and Antibody Responses in Patients with COVID-19
column11: Among the 231 urines and 211 plasmas collected from 67 patients, only 13 urines (5.6%) from 12 patients (18.8%) and 12 plasmas (5.7%) from 9 patients (14.3%) were positive for SARS-CoV-2 RNA

column3: Comparisons of nucleic acid conversion time of SARS-CoV-2 of different samples in ICU and non-ICU patients
column11: In the tests of blood, the positive rate was 87.5% (7/8) in ICU and 66.7% (16/24) in non-ICU patients respectively.

column3: Comparisons of nucleic acid conversion time of SARS-CoV-2 of different samples in ICU and non-ICU patients

column3: Epidemiologic Features and Clinical Course of Patients Infected With SARS-CoV-2 in Singapore
column11: Virus was detected by PCR in stool (4/8 patients [50%]) and in whole blood (1/12 [8%]); virus was not detected in urine (0/10 samples)

column3: Detectable 2019-nCoV viral RNA in blood is a strong indicator for the further clinical severity
column11: In the 57, 6 cases were detected to be blood positive, all of them (100%) were severe in symptom requiring special care attention, and the blood of the rest 51 cases was without detectable virus in the blood, only 12 of them (23.5%) were severe cases. ; presence of viral RNA in the blood and anal swab is positively correlated with the severe disease stage

column3: Molecular and serological investigation of 2019-nCoV infected patients: implication of multiple shedding routes
column11: 40% (6/15) of blood samples were positive; none of the patients with viremia blood had positive oral swabs
